fields.description:
h3. Request
We'd like to have the ability to configure Jira Service Management SLA so we could manually start/stop timers through automation rules. Basically, it would be great to have an automation "Action" to start/stop an SLA timer. Then we could set up an automation rule to trigger when a field value changes and set an action to stop an SLA timer.

Also if I select two things for an SLA timer to stop - Issue gets assigned AND a public comment is posted, the timer will stop if EITHER of them happen. There is no way to specify that BOTH need to happen.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding additional languages to a customer portal and setting it to the default, they are not displayed when a customer updates their language settings in their profile to match that language. Instead, the language settings for whatever language is set at the Jira server configuration level is used. This appears to happen for any language selected in the portal settings.
{panel}(!) This behaviour has been observed when the Jira server's language has been set to "English (Australia)", but may also impact other languages in different ways.{panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira Service Management project
# Go to *project settings* > *Language Support* and click *Add language*
# Select any language from the list and click *Add*. In this example we will use "français (France)".
# Click the language added from the list (in this case "français (France)") and create the necessary translations. Ensure that there are no yellow dots next to the 'Portal' or 'Request types' headings in the side bar to the left. When finished, click *Save* and return to the dashboard.
# Click *Change default language* and set your new language as the default and click *Change*
# Click the slider underneath 'Available to customers' for the language added to make it active.
# Create a customer in configuration > *User management* > *Users* with access to no applications
# From an Incognito/InPrivate window, log into the portal for the project created above with the newly created user.
# Staying in the portal now, click on the user icon in the top right and select *Profile*.
# Click on *Edit your profile*
# Change the language preference to the newly added language (in this case "français (France)") and click *Save*
# Return to the portal for that project

h3. Expected Results
The issue types, project name, project description and etc appear with the translated input from the project configuration "language support "settings

h3. Actual Results
The issue types, project name, project description and etc appear in the same language as the language the Jira server is configured for in system settings. Not the ones set up in the project configuration "language support "settings.

Also, in the project configuration "language support" settings you are unable to "Change default language" as it is greyed out.

h3. Workaround
# Add a third language (it doesn't matter what it is, let's say "italiano (Italia)")
# Enter in translations for it (the translations can be garbage data) and make it available to customers
# You can now change the default language. Select the third, newly added language (italiano (Italia))
# Observe that the original language added ("français (France)") now needs review.
# Click on that language ("français (France)") and note that the translations have been removed. Re-add the translations required and click *Save*.
# Your translations now appear in the portal. However, you are still unable to properly use the "Change default language" button
fields.summary: Creating project language translations are ignored by the system when one is set as the default

# Go to *Project Settings* > *Language support* > *Deutsch (Deutschland)*. For the Request type (as per Step 1), add relevent German translations for the fields.

# *User Profile Language is 'English'* - Go to the Customer portal > Help Center > Project > Request Type. On the create issue page, we can see all the custom content and links are displayed properly (as expected).
 !Screenshot 2021-03-31 at 7.40.25 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# *User Profile Language is 'German'* - Go to the Customer portal > Help Center > Project > Request Type. On the create issue page, we can see custom content and 'links' for *Request Type fields* ('Summary' & 'Description') are not rendered properly and they are displayed in their original format.

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
It's possible to import multiple projects from Google Cloud, but if a project is deleted on Google Cloud, the import does not begin even though there are other projects that can be imported in the configuration.

h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
# Set up to import from Google Cloud as per [this documentation|https://documentation.mindville.com/insight-googlecloud-integration/latest/setting-up-insight-googlecloud-integration].
# Create at least 2 projects in Google Cloud and perform the import, make sure it works.
# Delete 1 project in Google Cloud.
# Wait for the confirmation email that about the deleted project.
# Try to sync the import again without doing a test configuration. The sync will fail with an error saying could not connect to the service and error below can be found in the insight_import.log.
{code}
Error when importing objects with DefaultImportService, Error: ValidationInsightException: Validation errors were found: Connection: ErrorMessage{i18nKey='Could not connect to service', parameters=[], additionalMessage=null}; 
com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.common.exception.ValidationInsightException: ValidationInsightException: Validation errors were found: Connection: ErrorMessage{i18nKey='Could not connect to service', parameters=[], additionalMessage=null}; 
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.imports.common.DefaultImportService.testConnectionWithConfiguration(DefaultImportService.java:361)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.imports.common.DefaultImportService.testConnection(DefaultImportService.java:343)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.imports.common.DefaultImportService.testConnection(DefaultImportService.java:320)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.imports.common.DefaultImportService._startImport(DefaultImportService.java:567)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.imports.common.DefaultImportService.startImport(DefaultImportService.java:258)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.channel.web.api.rest.services.imports.ImportResource.startImport(ImportResource.java:100)
...
{code}

h3. Suggestion
Allow the sync for projects that can still be connected, with a message indicating the other projects that couldn't be synced, instead of failing altogether.

For customers that have many projects to be imported (230+ projects), validating the import configuration take hours. It's not feasible to update the configuration every time just to remove 1 deleted project.
fields.summary: Insight Google Cloud Integration - allow import as long as there's at least 1 project that can be imported

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently - missing objects are flagged per import configuration.

So, if the same object type is being updated by two different Import configuration - both with "Missing Objects" set to update a Status Attribute, with any threshold. After the threshold is reached on either import - the Status Attribute across all objects will fluctuate, depending on which Import was running last.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure 2 Import configurations (A, B) both updating the same Object Type for example: Importing from 2 Azure Subscriptions into the same Structure, with the Predefined mapping
 # Let each import run on schedule to accede the Threshold
 # Missing Objects Update on some object types is set to Update the Status Attribute to "Not found", Assume threshold is 2 syncs - for the explanation below
 # Notice Object A (included in Import A) and Object B (included in Import B) both belong to the same object type X

h3. Expected Results

Requested:

If an objects in the same object type is updated by any import, the Missing Object's Counter is reset:

Following the Imports along a timeline:
 Import A is running creating Object A

Import B is running creating Object B, flagging Object A as a Missing Object

Import A is running - Identifying Object A, Resetting Object A Flag, flagging Object B as a Missing Object

Import B is running - identifying Object B, Resetting Object B Flag, flagging Object A as a Missing Object

and so on - the end result: Status is not updated, unless an object is missing in BOTH the Imports for the given threshold
h3. Actual Results

Following the Imports along a timeline:
 Import A is running creating Object A

Import B is running creating Object B, flagging Object A as a Missing Object

Import A is running - Identifying Object A, flagging Object B as a Missing Object

Import B is running - identifying Object B, updating Status of Object A to "Not Found"(Threshold was reached)

Import A is running - identifying Object A, Updating Status of Object A to "Running", updating Status of Object B to "Not Found" (Threshold was reached)

Import B is running - identifying Object B, Updating Status of Object B to "Running", updating Status of Object A to "Not Found" (Threshold was reached)

and so on.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Either create a Root Object Type per subscription, so that each Import configuration will actually update its own Object Types,(Pros - Missing Objects will act as expected, Cons - hard to maintain, troubleshoot and requires more administration)

or;

Set Missing Objects to Ignore and configure an Automation rule to run on Schedule, and update Status to not found, if the object was not updated for a set period (Updated < now(-2d) - assuming that each Import will actually update the Objects (Pros - disregard the Missing Objects causing the Status to fluctuate. Cons - requires and Object update as a condition, and may add to performance when running)
fields.summary: Insight Missing Objects across all import configurations

fields.description:
Hi,

when referencing objects in Insight multi value attributes of type object the order in which the objects have been referenced is not maintained.

I raised a support request to describe the issue and why it is important to us that the order is maintained (see [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/3/SDS-58275).|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/3/SDS-58275)]

To keep a long story short: we have an attribute Managers and would like to express that the first Person referenced in this field is the main point of contact while additional Persons are secondary. We would also like to implement automation and reports relying on the order of referenced objects.

I also attach a screenshot where you can see that in the object's history the original order is shown, while in the attribute view the order is different. However, I'm not sure if uploading of the screenshot worked (I copied and pasted it into the description field).

!image-2021-04-01-13-00-32-669.png|width=933,height=440!

 

Don't hesitate to contact me if you have any further questions.

Kind regards,

Tobias
fields.summary: Maintain order of referenced objects in Insight attributes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When users browses in some environment, "Help and instructions" section breaks the layout in the portal.
In "Help and instructions" section in portal, [the element word-wrap: break-word; in CSS|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/word-break] is configured, but sometimes breaking the layout.
{code}
`word-wrap: break-word;` 
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Browser: Mac Google Chrome 89.0.4389.90（Official Build） （x86_64） 
JSM: Jira Service Management 4.13.4

 h4. Step 1
Configure "Help and instructions" in the portal with the following sentence
{code}
JiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDesk JiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDeskJiraServiceDesk
{code}

 h4. Step 2
Browse portal.

When changed browser's windows size, sometimes fixed.
- width: 800px(Bad)
--  !mac-chrome-responsive-800_790.png|thumbnail! 
- width: 750px(Good)
--  !mac-chrome-responsive-750_790.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
- The element `break word` in CSS works correctly without breaking the layout in the portal.

h3. Actual Results
- Sometimes "Help and instructions" section breaks the layout in the portal.

- Change browser window size
- Change the sentence in "Help and instructions", and avoid using long words.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight macro for Confluence v. 1.6.4

If you have an Inherited Structure created in your Schema using a Predefined Structure (Import), you will not be able to select 2nd / 3rd level Child Object Type Attributes in the Attribute Picker
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Object Type, and set "let the Attributes be inherited by object type children" to true
 # Configure an Import - e.g. Discovery Import - using the Predefined Structure and Configuration to create and map the Discovery Structure under the Parent Object type created in 1 (same goes to any predefined structure, but not to manually created children)
 # You can now enable all the object type maps and sync the import to get a few objects created
 # Navigate to a linked Confluence and create an Insight Object Macro to show Hosts and the MAC address from a Network Interface, use the IQL: objectType=Host
 # In the Attribute Picker, add the Hostname attribute from the Host Object Type as well as the IP4 and MAC Address from the referenced "Network Interface" object Type

h3. Expected Results

You can select the attributes mentioned from the Attribute Picker
h3. Actual Results

You only see the Parent object type in the Attribute Picker, but you do not see any Child Object Types from the Discovery Predefined structure
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

On each of the 1st level Child Object Type created by the Predefined structure

("Configuration","Network Assets",Asset Details") - add a local, dummy attribute (not to be populated at all) - refresh the IQL in the Macro, and move to the Attribute Picker; you will now be able to select Attributes from the whole Discovery Structure, and Attribute from Referenced Objects...
fields.summary: IMFC - Attribute Picker not allowing Attributes from inherited Children

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users using an old MySQL db driver (below v8.x) are facing issues when trying to access objects in Insight 8.7.7.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run Insight 8.7.7 with a MySQL db driver below v8.x. 

h3. Suggestion

Add support for MySQL database drivers versions below 8.x.
h3. Workaround

Upgrade db driver, recommended is v8.0.21 or later. Last suggestion is unfortunately to downgrade Insight to 8.7.6, run a reindex and wait until support for older version of db driver is released.
fields.summary: Create support for MySQL db driver below v8.x

h3. Issue Summary

Insight Macro for Confluence v.1.6.4

Set up the macro to correctly show a table/list of Insight Objects, then try to export the Macro results to CSV, using the link provided below the Macro on the page
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure the IMFC to show some objects on the Confluence page
 # Click "Export to CSV" below the Macro

h3. Expected Results

A CSV file will download, including the Macro's Data
h3. Actual Results

An error on screen (attached):
{quote}
The CSV Export failed

TypeError: Td(...) is not a function
{quote}
No entry in the Confluence / Browser log
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Export the page to a Word Document, then copy the table and past it to an excel sheet

fields.description:
h3. Requirement/Used Case:

This is related to [JSDSERVER-7200|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-7200] but for a non-Insight Custom field. 

- three custom fields can be set by JSM portal, mail handler or phone system with customer data (one or more values)
- *IF* these fields are set (in combination or single) these values should be used as additional object filter
- *ELSE* if these fields are empty (NULL) no additional filtering should be used and all objects should be shown

h3. Suggestion:

As we need to have a condition for ${TextField} != null - (which is not a correct syntax in Insight atm). So it could be a CF configuration option, something like:
If IQL returns nothing, overrule the Filter Issue Scope... so the CF will return all objects according to the Filter Scope only.
fields.summary: Add ability to check if the Non-Insight custom field placeholder is NULL

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We are experiencing troubles with the Integration!The provider,  Botronsoft stated the following:

"It seems that they implement the [Custom Field configuration SPI|https://botronsoft.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CMJ/pages/1131184355/Custom+Fields+SPI], but they haven’t implemented the [field data|https://botronsoft.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CMJ/pages/1395261485/Custom+Field+Data+SPI] or [project data|https://botronsoft.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CMJ/pages/1394999304/Project+Issue+Data+SPI] SPI’s. You can check the current integration by going to CMJ’s App Integrations page in your Jira instance.

If some data is missing it’s likely that it is not provided by the implementations Insight has done."

So what happens is: We can migrate Insight custom fields with configuration without problems. BUT The customfields do not contain any data. 
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Continuation of: [ICS-1058|https://jira.mindville.com/browse/ICS-1058]
 # Export the Insight CF configuration using the CMJ

h3. Expected Results

CF Values are also migrated
h3. Actual Results

No CF values/data are included in the Snapshot
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

This request may not be applicable for Insight, as the CF Values refer to existing object IDs in the Insight Tables.
 As such, this is logged as a Suggestion for improvement.
fields.summary: Insight Integration with CMJ is not complete

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Affected Insight Version: 8.7.7

Any Object which has a reference to another object, if you hover over a Historical object value in the attribute - will trigger an error message, but clicking will navigate to the object.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate in the Schema view to an Object Type which has References to other objects
 # Switch to Detail View
 # Edit the objects - by changing the value of the referenced attribute (e.g. from object X to object Y)
 # In the object's History tab, hover over any of the Object Links showing (Old / New Value)

h3. Expected Results

Tooltip is showing (same is in the Object's Details)
h3. Actual Results

An Error banner:

"Sorry, you do not have permission to perform this action.. PermissionInsightException: User myUser didn't have correct permission (view) for object: 1,261,420"

Clicking the object will redirect to the object - so no actual Permission issue
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

This is just an error popup - but has no effect on functionality.
fields.summary: Hovering over referenced Objects in Detail View - will generate an error message

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Updating to a new reference type value in the attribute page for an already create Object Reference attribute throws an error on save.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Object with an Object Reference Attribute.
 # Click into the additional value column and change it.
 # Click Update. (Nothing happens).
 # Click Update again. (Error is thrown)

h3. Expected Results

The additional value should change
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens after first update and the second update throws an error

 
h3. Workaround

 The new reference type value is created so after clicking out and clicking back in, you will be able to change the reference type value to the new value.

 

 
h3. Affected Version 

 8.7.7
fields.summary: Updating to a new Reference Type Value throws error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Move object option is available for Developers role users on object view screen   

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Grant a user the *Object Schema Developers* role and the *Object Type Developer* role on 2 object types.
 # As the user with the roles above, go to the object schema and browse an object type which you have the *Object Type Developer* role for.
 # Try to move an object from the object type by clicking on the More button --> Move, the option is not clickable.
 # Click on the object key to go into the object view screen and try to Move this object again.

h3. Expected Results
The Move button is not clickable on both screens, since Developers role cannot move an object from an object type
 !image-2021-03-24-09-24-43-592.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The Move button is clickable in the object view screen. Developers role users can attempt to move the object, map the attributes but eventually this fails with insufficient permission. In the end, the object cannot be moved.
 !image-2021-03-24-09-16-06-134.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
N/A. A user must be in the Insight Managers or Insight Administrators role to be able to Move an object away from an object type and if the user has the required role, the Move button will be clickable on both screens.
fields.summary: Move object option is available for Developers role users on object view screen

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Insight audit logs only show object related events such as creating objects, deleting objects and updating attributes. 

When an attribute is added or remove from an object type, we don't log that info. 
This is important because deleting an attribute from an object type will effectively delete all attribute values from all objects of that object type. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option to log object type events in the audit logs. 
h3. Workaround
Inspect the access logs for PUT/POST/DELETE to */rest/insight/1.0/objecttypeattribute/*.
fields.summary: Insight audit log should log object type events

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Insight post function does not update the object value during bulk update.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure 2 insight custom field for eg: Service and Service Owner
 # Configure post function "Assign Objects from an IQL query based on data from an issue. "to update the service owner field 
# When the service field is updated the Service owner field should auto populate. 
# This works fine for single issue. 


h3. Expected Results
# When you run the bulk edit through Jira and update Service field, you expect the value of Service owner field will also change. 

h3. Actual Results
Value for Service Owner field does not update. 


h3. Workaround
Do not use bulk update to update the insight custom field.
fields.summary: Insight post function does not update the insight custom field value during bulk update.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Performance - loading a lot of objects with avatars causes the macro to make too many requests. Based on: [https://jira.mindville.com/browse/IMFC-72]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # The way I was able to reproduce this bug was by doing the following :
 ## Setup an LDAP with 3000 Users, connect it to Jira
 ## set for some/all of these users avatars
 ## Setup a Jira user import in Insight
 ## Connect the macro to user import schema
 ## Look at the network tab for the images tab requests

h3. Expected Results

The macro should request one avatar per object
h3. Actual Results

The macro actually doubles that number for the number of requests which overloads the server when viewing many objects per macro (500), causes application crash


{code:java}
#
# Fatal error in CALL_AND_RETRY_LAST
# Allocation failed - process out of memory
#

#
# A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
#
# SIGILL (0x4) at pc=0x00007f89e298fa19, pid=657, tid=1680
#
# JRE version: OpenJDK Runtime Environment AdoptOpenJDK (11.0.10+9) (build 11.0.10+9)
# Java VM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM AdoptOpenJDK (11.0.10+9, mixed mode, tiered, compressed oops, g1 gc, linux-amd64)
# Problematic frame:
# C [libj2v8_linux_x86_64.so+0xae3a19] v8::base::OS::Abort()+0x9{code}
h3. Workaround

Setting the macro to load small number of objects (25 while testing). You can defined more than one macro per page loading 25 each and the correct number of avatars will be called-
fields.summary: Performance - loading a lot of objects with avatars causes the macro to make too many requests

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Default Cron expression in Scheduled Event for an Automation rule is invalid
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a new Automation rule
 # Give it a name, and set up WHEN: Scheduled Event
 # Enter the IQL: Name IS NOT EMPTY, notice the Schedule is already showing a CRON Expression: 0 0 1 * *
 # Configure THEN: Attribute Value> set Name with ${Key} //or any other action
 # Select a User to be the Actor (Required) and save the Automation Rule

h3. Expected Results

Rule is saved, then executed in time
h3. Actual Results

The rule cannot be saved, and showing an Error Banner to indicate the Cron expression is invalid - which is correct.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Indicate any valid cron expression will allow you to save the rule.

Or, simply add ' ?' (whitespace + Question Mark) at the end of the default CRON expression, as the Default Cron Value should be: 0 0 1 * * ? = daily at 01:00AM
fields.summary: UI Bug : Scheduled Event has an Invalid default CRON in Insight Automation

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Opening CSV export file in MS Excel with number columns with leading zeros causes excel to remove the leading zeros in view 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add ability to CSV export all columns in "text" format for Insight

h3. Why This Is Important
Customers ability to use these exports for reporting/BI etc on excel gets hindered if this is not added

h3. Workaround
* Use Microsofts KB on how to keep leading Zeros on the view: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/keeping-leading-zeros-and-large-numbers-1bf7b935-36e1-4985-842f-5dfa51f85fe7
* Use google sheets or some other CSV application which doesn't convert the raw values
* Introduce a character prefix to the number only fields viz., "N-00012345" instead of "00012345"
fields.summary: Add ability to CSV export all columns in "text" format for Insight

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue description
According to https://insight-javadoc.riada.io/insight-javadoc-8.6/insight-rest/#objectconnectedtickets, the only required parameter for this endpoint to return all connected Jira issues with an object is the object ID. However, this returns 404 error.

{{/tickets}} is required after the object ID but this does not return issues that are resolved (i.e. Resolution is EMPTY). To get all issues regardless of the resolution, we can make use of the *filterId* parameter by first creating a JQL filter for the desired issues and include the filter ID in the endpoint.

The GET call would look like this
{code}
<Jira_base_URL>/rest/insight/1.0/objectconnectedtickets/<object_ID>/tickets?filterId=<filter_ID>
{code}

h3. Suggestion
Include the above in the documentation
fields.summary: Update API documentation with info to return all object connected issues

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Insight 8.4 introduces {{getObjectAttributeBeans()}} JAVA API. As a result, REST API only returns attribute that has values associated to it. Attributes without any values will not be returned in the result. 

As compared to Insight 8.3.x, an attribute is returned even without values. See [ICS-1866|https://jira.mindville.com/browse/ICS-1866] for more information. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the Insight REST API documentation. 
 
h3. Workaround
No workaround as of now.
fields.summary: Update Insight REST API documentation

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
No *Request Resolved* notification is sent to customers, if the transition in the SD project has:
# A screen associated with the *Resolution* field *AND*
# A post-function setting the field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an SD project
# Create a transition that resolves the issue
# Create a post-function to set the 'Resolution' to some value, such as:
#* !workflowtransition.png|thumbnail!
# Associate a screen with the 'Resolution' field included. (set to *Done* by default)
#* !screenres.png|thumbnail!
# Create and Resolve the issue.

h3. Expected Results
Customer will receive notification for *Request Resolved*

h3. Actual Results
Notification for *Request Resolved* is not sent to the customer. Customer still receive the notification for *Customer-visible status changed*.

(i) This happens only if the *Resolution* is the same as the default (in this case *Done*) set in post-function. If the *Resolution* in the screen is set to non-default (for example, *Won't Do*), the *Request Resolved* notification will be send to the customer. Another observation is that in this case, there will be no issue history that set the Resolution.

h3. Workaround
# Remove the post function that sets the resolution
# *OR* un-link the screen from the transition
fields.summary: Setting Issue Resolution Twice is preventing 'Request Resolved' notification in JSD

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When your Jira instance is set to Russian, and you use a date picker to populate a Date Attribute in Insight - once you have clicked on a Date in the Date Picker - the Attribute will show the name of the previous month.

Reproduced in Insight 9.0.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Object Type with a Date Type Attribute
 # Change the Jira Language to Russian
 # Create an Object and use the Date Picker to show the Calendar.
 # Click any day in March

h3. Expected Results

The Attribute will populate with the value (date, month and year) selected in the picker e.g. 10/MAR/21 (March stated in Russian)
h3. Actual Results

The Attribute Populates on the Create / Edit Screen with the value 10/Feb/21 (February stated in Russian)
{noformat}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Once the Object is Created or the update is saved - the Attribute will show the correct month, in Russian.

The Issue does not happen in English - so might be a local Translation issue related to the Date Picker
fields.summary: Worng month when using the Insight Date Picker in Russian

fields.description:
h3. Issue description
The value of a Textarea type attribute is stored in HTML format. There's no way to change the format to plain text and no alternative if we want to use a multi-line text field

h3. Suggestion
A plain text Textarea attribute or feature to disable HTML

h3. Use case
The value of a Textarea attribute is copied to a Jira field. The copied values have HTML tags that do not mean anything in a Jira field that uses Wiki markup.

h3. Workaround
* Use Insight post function with groovy script to remove all HTML tags and put the resulting text into a Single Line text custom field. An example script can be found in [this comment|https://jira.mindville.com/browse/ICS-1190]
fields.summary: Plain text Textarea attribute

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The value of textarea type attribute is shown as unknown on the portal

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object type with a *textarea* type attribute.
 # Create an object with a value for the *textarea* type attribute.
 # Create a custom field and configure it accordingly so that the object can be selected from the Customer Portal.
 # On the raise request screen on the portal, use the object picker to view the details of the object created above, pay attention to the value *textarea* type attribute.

h3. Expected Results

The value is shown as it is
h3. Actual Results

The value is shown as *Unknown* on the portal. However, this does not affect other Jira views like the create issue screen.
 !image-2021-03-17-10-33-41-135.png|thumbnail!

With Jira 4.19.1 the object details are not shown at all, as soon as there is a value in the textarea type attribute

!image-2021-10-11-15-33-35-477.png!

In the web console, there's error with rendering the value.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

or (4.19.1) like this:

!image-2021-10-11-15-35-20-387.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The value of textarea type attribute is shown as unknown on the portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using a JSON or CSV import, Dates which are stored in source as a string of numbers, will be treated as UNIX Timestamp

Insight 8.7.6
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In an Object Type, add a Date type Attribute
 # Create a CSV or JSON source / file to import, and make sure to have a column for dates formatted as yyyyMMdd, e.g. 20200316 
 # Configure an Import for this source, and indicate the date format yyyyMMdd in the Import Configuration.
 # Map the Date column to the Date Attribute
 # Synchronize the import

h3. Expected Results

The date value will be imported and interpreted per the Date Format, and the value displayed in the Attribute will show according to the Date Picker in Jira
h3. Actual Results

The date will show a wrong value, for example: 22 Aug, 1970 or 22.08.70

Which matches the value calculated if treating 20200316 as a UNIX Timestamp
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

If possible - try and add separators to the source value, and indicate them in the Date Format configuration, for example:
2020.03.16
And the date format: yyyy.MM.dd
fields.summary: Import a string of numbers into a Date Type attribute will result in wrong value

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Cloned from [https://jira.mindville.com/browse/ICS-1869]

h3. Issue Summary
After upgrading to the Insight version 8.6.13, only object schema managers are able to select user(s) from the User attribute field. Object Schema Developers could only perform the same action on the Object view page and not the Object list page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an object type with an attribute of User type.
# Log in as a user with the Object Schema Manager role to select a user for the attribute and save it.
# Log in as another user with Object Schema Developer role, find the object from the object list page (Schema > Object Type) and edit the User attribute.
# Go to the object view page and edit the User attribute.

h3. Expected Results
User is able to edit the User attribute on any views as long as the user has the permission to do so

h3. Actual Results
User gets the "The Jira server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation." when attempting to edit the User attribute on the object list view page below
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

However, this does not occur if the user edit the attribute in the Object view itself
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Open the object in a new tab or on the same tab to edit it in the Object view page
(i) For JSM versions below 4.15.0, it's possible to downgrade Insight to 8.7.3 or 8.6.12.
fields.summary: Only Object Schema Managers are able to change the user attribute field

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When configuring the Insight Jira and Bitbucket Import, one must indicate a valid User (Admin) who has access to the Data, and will be used for authenticating the Jira APIs fired by the Integration Module. Instead, the User is not validated and the APIs are attempted anyway. If the Password was changed, the User will be blocked due to many false login attempts.

Insight 8.7.6
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the Insight Jira Environment and BB integration module
 # Configure a Jira Environment Import in a Schema, when required to provide User credentials: set the Admin User name, but any not valid password, e.g. 12345
 # Click the "Test Configuration" button - it will confirm "Configuration Tested", even if the Username is wrong / non-existing, and PW is incorrect
 # Set any Schema manager to be the "Executing User" of the import, and configure Auto-sync every 3 min.
 # Create a Predefined Structure and Configuration - this will work.
 # Make sure that the Admin User is not logged in

h3. Expected Results
 # when Testing configuration with wrong credentials - it should be indicated
 # If credentials check failed - the Import will not be able to retrieve any data (as the User is not authenticated)
 # If running - The Import should create objects only for Information accessible to the authenticated User. If the User Authentication fails - no information can be retriveed.

h3. Actual Results

Insight succeeds in getting a lot of information, BUT Jira logs and User Management shows thousands of failed login attempts (invoking Captcha for example)

Licenses Objects: only Jira application Licenses are imported (With a correct Password - more License objects will be created)
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Make sure you set the correct credentials in the import configuration
fields.summary: Insight IJBI integration - Authentication of User is not validated when configuring the import

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Exporting objects using desired encoding always ends up with UTF-8 encoding instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an asset using characters from ISO-8859-15 charset:
 !image-2021-03-15-14-13-26-574.png|thumbnail! 
 # Open object view > cog icon > Export objects
 # Select ISO-8859-15 encoding > Export
 # Open the file in a text editor and observe the results
 # Run "file" command to confirm the charset:
{code:java}
file -ib export.csv{code}

h3. Expected Results
* Reviewing the hexadecimal representation of the file reveals properly encoded characters. For example, character 'ä' matches its hexadecimal representation 'e4' for encoding ISO-8859-15:
 !image-2021-03-15-14-12-30-182.png|thumbnail! 
* {{file -bi export.csv}} Linux command shows the desired charset:
{code:java}
$ file -I export.csv
export.csv: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
{code}

h3. Actual Results
* Reviewing the hexadecimal representation of the file reveals the same character is being encoded with UTF-8 'c3 a4':
 !image-2021-03-15-14-12-41-345.png|thumbnail! 
* {{file -bi export.csv}} Linux command shows the utf-8 charset:
{code:java}
$ file -I export.csv
export.csv: text/plain; charset=uf-8
{code}

h3. Workaround
Reopen or import the CSV file and select desired encoding in the used program / tool.

h3. Notes
* This bug ticket originates from https://jira.mindville.com/browse/ICS-1888, which was only partially fixed.
* The behaviour is not present in Insight 8.6.7, but became present in the following versions.
fields.summary: Exporting objects using desired encoding always ends up with UTF-8 encoding instead.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When integrating Service Desk Server with a *Confluence Cloud Space* to serve customers with a knowledge base, the customers are required to be logged in to Confluence Cloud for the Integration to work seamlessly. 

When the customer is not logged in, instead of displaying the KB article or the log in screen in the customer portal in an iFrame, the following will happen:
 - in Chrome, a grey page will show in the iFrame. There is a link available on the page which allows the user to open the page in a new window, so that they can log into Confluence Cloud. However, this link is very small and can be easily missed:
{code:java}
Open Site in New Window
{code}

 - in Firefox, the following message will appear in the iFrame:
{code:java}
Firefox can't open this page.
Open Site in New Window
{code}

 - in Safari: The issue is not present, however Safari opens each KB article in a new tab instead of the iframe

h3. Notes
 - This issue only impacts the integration between Service Desk Server and *Confluence Cloud*
 -- This issue does not impact the integration between Service Desk Server and *Confluence Server*
 - The integration between Service Desk Server and Confluence Cloud *is only available in Service Desk Server version 4.12.0* and above.

h3. Steps to replicate
 - Setup a Confluence Cloud without anonymous access on the whole instance (so that users have to login to access any Confluence page)
 - Create a space in Confluence Cloud, and will be used as a Knowledge Base space, and add at least one page to that space
 - Setup Service Desk Server on any version from 4.12.0 or above
 - Create a Service Desk project, and configure it with a Knowledge Base coming from Confluence Cloud, as per [Set up a knowledge base with Confluence Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/set-up-a-knowledge-base-with-confluence-cloud-1018775526.html]
 - Log into the Customer Portal, with a *user who is not already logged in into Confluence Cloud*
 - Search for a KB article from Confluence Cloud, in the Customer portal. You should be shown some result:
 !Bug_Step1.png|thumbnail!
 - Click on the KB article to open it in an iFrame

h3. Expected results

The KB article or the log in screen should be displayed in an iFrame:
 !Bug_ExpectedResults.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual results
 - In Chrome, a grey page will show in the iFrame (along with a very small link at the bottom of the page that can be used to open the page in a new window). Also, the following error will be displayed in the browser console:
{code:java}
Refused to display 'https://id.atlassian.com/' in a frame because it set 'X-Frame-Options' to 'sameorigin'.
{code}
!Bug_Step2_Chrome.png|thumbnail!

 - in Firefox, the following message will appear in the iFrame:
{code:java}
Firefox can't open this page.
Open Site in New Window
{code}
!Bug_Step2_Firefox.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workarounds
h4. Workaround 1

*Firefox*: Click on the button displayed in the place of the article and log in to Confluence in another tab. Then you can go back to the Customer Portal and view all the articles you have access to.

*Chrome*, *Firefox* and *other* browsers: Click on the "View article in new window" link that is displayed below where the article should be.

!Bug_ExpectedResults_highlighted.png|width=519,height=254!
h4. Workaround 2

Configure the Confluence Cloud instance with anonymous access, as per [Setting Up Public Access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/setting-up-public-access-156.html].
 !Workaround_Step1.png|thumbnail!

In addition to this, also configure the Confluence Cloud KB Space with anonymous access:
 !Workaround_Step2.png|thumbnail!

With such configuration, Service Desk customers will no longer have to be logged into Confluence Cloud to view any KB article, and the KB article will be displayed in the iFrame.

*Please note*, that individual page trees and pages in Confluence can be configured to follow different permission restriction, and not be available to the anonymous users together with the KB articles that are.

 
h3. Suggestions for this feature request

Note that this ticket is raised as a feature request, since the current behavior *is expected by design*, and is explained in the documentation [Set up a knowledge base with Confluence Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/set-up-a-knowledge-base-with-confluence-cloud-1018775526.html]. 
 However, this current behavior may cause a lot of confusion for the end user, since end users might not be aware that they are supposed to be logged into Confluence Cloud prior to opening any KB article.

Also, when using Chrome, all the user sees is a gray page with a very small link at the bottom, giving the option to open the page in a new window, which is not very user friendly.

Some improvement suggestions are the following:
 - make the link "Open Site in New Window" bigger or more visible to the end user, so that it's more obvious to them that they need to open the page in a new window to log into Confluence?
 - or maybe add a big banner/warning telling the customers that they need to log into Confluence in a new window?
fields.summary: Knowledge Base articles can't be opened in the customer portal if Confluence Cloud is not configured with anonymous access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the Default Language is set to a language that uses the Cyrillic Alphabet, upon creating a Software Project all Workflows Schemes and workflows names are created with Latin Alphabet. Upon trying to change it causes the UI not to respond.
(i) This behavior is not seen when creating a Service Management Project, as all Workflows Schemes and Workflows names are created with Cyrillic characters as expected. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # We have installed a fresh Jira Service Management instance on versions 4.13.4, 4.14.1, and 4.15.0.
 # Change the default language to Cyrillic.
 # Create a Software Project and navigate to Workflows to check on which language their names are.
 # Try to change workflow names to Cyrillic just to confirm if in the opposite way. An error is returned (screenshot attached).
 # Attempting to edit workflow names to English causes the UI to be unresponsive and the workflow is not updated.


h3. Expected Results
It is expected to be able to change Workflow names to latin English or any other language that use Latin Alphabet.

h3. Actual Results
It is not possible to change Workflow names to any language that use Latin Alphabet. Attempting to edit the workflow name leads to unresponsiveness in the UI.

h3. Workaround
There is no known workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: Error when trying to change Workflow names from Cyrillic to any language in Latin Alphabet

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a JSM project that has a board is accessed through a mobile app, it will open the board, and there is no option to switch to the default issues timeline view like for any other project that does not have a board.

Boards by default do not make sense in JSD projects, issues list is more useful.

This creates a user experience problem, and some maybe confused by this behavior.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board in JSM project
 # Access that project via a mobile app

h3. Expected Results

At least have an option to switch to the default issues timeline.
h3. Actual Results

The app shows the board and there is no way to switch to other views.
h3. Workaround

Have a custom filter configured for your project, and access the filter through "Issues" tab.
fields.summary: It is not possible to switch to the list of issues in a mobile app of a JSD project has a board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Since v.8.6.0 Schema Managers can configure the New Object's Page Layout using Widgets.

The Attributes Widget can be configured with a list of Attributes to show. The Attribute Picker however, does not allow the selection of the four default Attributes. In certain Use Cases, we would have a Label which is not the attribute labeled Name.

The Attribute Picker cannot find any Attribute labeled "Name"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an Object Type with a text attribute added to it, e.g. "TestAtt", and any other attribute (e.g. a User, Boolean etc)
 # Populate this Attribute across you objects in this object type
 # In the Object Type>Attributes Tab, set "TestAtt" as the Object Type's Label
 # Navigate to any Object Page, the "Name" is clearly showing in the Attributes Tab
 # Navigate to ObjectType>Configure>Configure page layout
 # In the Page Layout screen>Attributes Tab, see that "Name" is not showing in the List of Attributes to display.
 # Remove one Attribute from the list (e.g. the Boolean Attribute), or simply click to Clear All, then try to add the Name Attribute only.

h3. Expected Results

You can find the Name Attribute from the Attribute Picker, and be able to select it to be displayed on the object page
h3. Actual Results

The Name Attribute cannot be selected here, and it will not show on the Object Page
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

In the Attribute Picker - click the option to Add All - in order to show ALL available attributes, including the one called Name (Key, Updated and Created will still be excluded as these will be displayed regardless on the object page itself)

Note that unless you choose to Select All, you will not be able to see the Name Attribute, for example, click Select All, then remove one attribute from the list - the Name will no longer show on the page...
fields.summary: Insight New Object Page layout - cannot select Default Attributes to show in the Attributes widget

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Object selected using object picker is not copied by ScriptRunner's Behaviour

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create an Insight object custom field and configure it so that JSM customers can choose an object in the portal.
# Create another Jira custom field (text type) to hold the value copied from step 1.
# Add both fields to the request type.
# Configure ScriptRunner's Behaviours to copy the object value. Map the field to the Service Management request type and configure server-side script as follows (example).
(i) Replace _____ in the last second line with the name of the custom field created in step 2.
{code}
import com.onresolve.jira.groovy.user.FieldBehaviours
import com.onresolve.jira.groovy.user.FormField
import groovy.transform.BaseScript

@BaseScript FieldBehaviours fieldBehaviours

def cf1 = getFieldById(getFieldChanged())
String selectedVal = cf1.value

def cf2 = getFieldByName("_____")
cf2.setFormValue(selectedVal)
{code}
# Go to the request creation form and select an object from the drop-down as well as using the object picker.

h3. Actual result
The value is copied when object is selected using the drop-down (or type and select) but not with object picker

h3. Suggestion
To make the behaviour consistent for object selected via drop-down and object picker

h3. Workaround
Disable the object picker from the portal
 !image-2021-03-10-15-37-51-749.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This is not a bug but an improvement we can make on our side to make sure the result is consistent when an object is selected via different methods
fields.summary: Standardise behaviours when selecting an Insight object via drop-down vs object picker

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

JSM's PSMQ (message queue) system uses two database tables to track messages and queue - \{{AO_319474_MESSAGE}} and \{{AO_319474_QUEUE}}

Messages and created and destroyed dynamically with the running application. Queue's are created and updated on demand, but are not removed dynamically. Instead, a scheduled job, {{com.atlassian.psmq.internal.scheduled.QueueCleanupScheduledJob}} ,  is used to clean up queues that have not been used in 7 days. 

The logic is defined in +psmq/core/src/main/java/com/atlassian/psmq/internal/io/db/QueueCleanupDao.java+:
{code:java}
        final List<Long> idsToDelete =
                databaseConnection.select(QUEUE.ID)
                        .forUpdate()
                        .from(QUEUE)
                        .where(QUEUE.MODIFIED_TIME.loe(unusedSince.getMillis())
                                .and(QUEUE.CLAIMANT.isNull().and(QUEUE.CLAIMANT_TIME.isNull().or(QUEUE.CLAIMANT_TIME.loe(unusedSince.getMillis()))))
                                .and(QUEUE.ID.notIn(select(MESSAGE.QUEUE_ID).distinct().from(MESSAGE))))
                        .limit(limit)
                        .fetch();{code}
This works well, however it does not cater for MESSAGE rows that are not able to get destroyed
{code:java}
.and(QUEUE.ID.notIn(select(MESSAGE.QUEUE_ID).distinct().from(MESSAGE))))
{code}
Known trigger for stale MESSAGE rows
 * Application is restarted with Active Messages due to PSMQ deadlock (In JSM <v4.9)

This results in stale MESSAGEs building up in the system, of whom's QUEUES then cannot be cleaned up.
h4. Suggested Solution
 - Modify the logic to remove MESSAGE rows if they are not claimed within 7 days. This would result in the queue clean up task to remove queues that aren't used, but are held open by stale message rows being present.
fields.summary: Add cleaning stale MESSAGE rows to PSMQ clean up task

fields.description:
When using a CSV import to import a data set that should update the existing Objects already in Insight (needs to update two attributes on these Objects). 

If the Object is not present based on the identifier, it should not create a new Object. 

Another example will be:

- I would like to create computer Accounts based on the data available in SCCM.
- Also, I would like some additional information for the accounts available in SCCM from the Active Directory.

The problem I'm running into is that, as most ADs I've seen too far, it's not the cleanest system and there's a lot of outdated or unused computer accounts, which would now also be created as objects.

So in this case I would like the SCCM import to be the "main system" to be able to create objects and I would like the AD import only to add data to existing objects.

Long story short: We need an option in the import "do not create new objects, only update existing ones"
fields.summary: Import feature - "Do not create new objects"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Automation rule does not check for condition in Insight 8.7.5 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Insight 8.7.4, create an Insight automation rule with example below.
{code}
WHEN: object created
IF: objectType = objectA
THEN: Create Jira issue
{code}
 # Test the automation rule by creating an object of type objectA and another one of a different object type.
# Update the plugin to 8.7.5 and test the same.

h3. Expected Results
On 8.7.4 and 8.7.5, the automation rule is triggered and a Jira issue is created only when an object of type objectA is created.

h3. Actual Results
On 8.7.5, the automation rule is triggered regardless of the condition. The condition is not checked/validated.

h3. Workaround
Downgrade the Insight plugin to 8.7.4
fields.summary: Automation rule does not check for condition in Insight 8.7.5

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Security Level field starts being visible / editable in 4.13 when configuring request types for a portal although I was unable to find a specific mention of this feature. However, request types configured with security levels prior to 4.13 are not updated in the database accordingly and thus behave differently even after upgrading

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Service Desk 4.5
 # Make Security Level field required
 # Add Security Level field to a request type in a service desk
## Note that you cannot make Security Level visible
 # Upgrade to Service Desk 4.13
# Add Security Level field to a new request type in a new service desk
## Here you can make Security Level visible
# Go back and observe the 4.5 service desk in unchanged 

h3. Expected Results
Service desk projects / request types configured before 4.13 can show the Security Level field accordingly

h3. Actual Results
The underlying database entries are not updated during the upgrade

The below was observed after setting up Service Desk 4.5, upgrading to 4.13, and configuring 2 portals with a few different request types. The unsupported field_type values are from 4.5 and the select field_type values are from 4.13:
{code}
 select * from "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELD" where "LABEL" = 'Security Level';                                                                          
 DESCRIPTION | DISPLAYED | FIELD_ID | FIELD_ORDER | FIELD_TYPE  | FORM_ID | ID  |     LABEL      | REQUIRED 
-------------+-----------+----------+-------------+-------------+---------+-----+----------------+----------
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |      17 |  68 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |       1 |  69 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |       2 |  70 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |       3 |  71 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |       4 |  72 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |       5 |  73 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |       6 |  74 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |       7 |  75 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |       8 |  76 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |       9 |  77 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |      10 |  78 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |      11 |  79 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |      12 |  80 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |      13 |  81 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |      14 |  82 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |      15 |  83 | Security Level | t
             | f         | security |           0 | unsupported |      16 |  84 | Security Level | t
             | t         | security |           4 | select      |      18 | 108 | Security Level | t
             | t         | security |           3 | select      |      19 | 109 | Security Level | t
             | t         | security |           3 | select      |      20 | 110 | Security Level | t
             | t         | security |           3 | select      |      21 | 111 | Security Level | t
             | t         | security |           3 | select      |      22 | 112 | Security Level | t
             | t         | security |           3 | select      |      23 | 113 | Security Level | t
             | t         | security |           3 | select      |      24 | 114 | Security Level | t
{code}

h3. Workaround
The following SQL will upgrade the Security Level field on request type configurations:
{code}
update "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELD" set "FIELD_TYPE" = 'select' where "LABEL" = 'Security Level' and "FIELD_TYPE" = 'unsupported';
{code}
fields.summary: Security Level visibility changes after 8.13, upgrade task missing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When importing large number of accounts using [AWS integration app|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1218757/insight-aws-integration], Insight tries to load all objects in memory. However, sometimes the user is only interested in importing a subset of objects only. So it is important that there are options available using which a user can filter based on tags or other parameters and only load the objects that are required for the import.  


h3. Suggested Solution
Allow filtering options for the AWS import that can filter data based on AWS tags and only load the relevant rows into Insight.
fields.summary: As an admin, when using AWS integration I would like to configure filtering of objects before the import

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The current [Insight api for imports|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/ICV8/Import+-+REST] is quite limited in terms of its features. As an Insight admin that needs to configure a large number of imports, it would be useful to be able to do this through API. That would also make it possible to update these configurations.
h3. Suggested Solution

We can add the functionality for the Insight import to be picked up from a flat-file. Admins would need to configure this file and update it if any changes need to be made.
fields.summary: As an Insight admin I would like to have Insight api to create import configuration

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Customers are not able to view and search for objects on Customer Portal

h3. Environment
Insight version 9.0.2, 8.6.13, 8.6.14

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Follow [this documentation|https://documentation.mindville.com/insight/latest/integration-with-jira-service-desk-33466851.html] to enable an Insight custom field in the Customer Portal.
 # As a JSM customer, try raising a request and select an object under the Insight custom field.

h3. Expected Results
Customer is able to see suggested objects under the Insight custom field and select an object (respecting the role permission settings of the object type and objects)

h3. Actual Results
Customer is unable to see and select any objects under the Insight custom field

h3. Workaround
* Create a user group for Customers and add the group to the Object Schema Users role
(!) This, however, allow JSM Customers to have some REST API access which could be a security concern
 !image-2021-03-04-16-02-11-604.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Original bug reported at https://jira.mindville.com/browse/ICS-1865
* Not affecting 8.6.12 and below, and 8.6.15, 8.7.4, 8.7.7
fields.summary: Customers are not able to view and search for Insight objects on Customer Portal despite Object Schema Users permissions for JSM Customers are enabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Object Label/Name gets hidden in the View all inbound references with many references (Additional value)

* Open an object with a many (5-6 with long reference names) different inbound references in the {{<BASE-URL>/secure/insight/assets/<OBJECT-X>}} 
* Click on "*View all inbound references*":
!2021-03-04_16-23-32.png|thumbnail!
* The object label is hidden with lot of inbound references
!2021-03-04_16-23-21.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution
* Either add the scrolling left capability to show the label of the object
* Or at least add mouse hover on the object icon should show the name/label of the object

h3. Why This Is Important
This popup window gives users a one stop look at all the inbound references in one glance. Having some object labels hown and some objects labels not shown it creates confusing view of the pop up.

h3. Workaround
Click on "View all in object search"
fields.summary: Ability to see the label/name of the object even with many inbound references (Additional value)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using Insight post function to copy a date attribute to a Jira custom fie

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* In any ObjectType, create an attribute Type Value date;
* Create an Insight Custom field (Field A) and add it to the issue screen;
* Configure the Insight custom field;
* Use the date attribute in Object attributes on Issue view;
* Create a Date picker custom field and add it to the project screens;
* In the Project workflow, create a Insight Post Function in any transition, and select 'Set a Jira custom field with the attribute value from a selected object'
* Use the Insight field as Source, and the Jira date picker field as Target, make sure to use the date attribute in 'Insight Object Type Attribute name'


h3. Expected Results

* When performing the transition, the date copied to Jira custom field should be the same as the attribute.

h3. Actual Results
* When performing the transition, the date will be copied one day before the attribute date.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Reproduced in Insight 9.0.2 bundled version, and 8.7.2

h3. Workaround
No workaround is currently available
fields.summary: Insight post function - Date attribute to Jira date picker custom field will copy the wrong date by one day

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Insight post function to create an Insight Object from a Jira Issue does not set date time value correctly if Jira is using non-default date time picker format.

In a newer version Jira 8.20.1 (Insight 9.1.3), objects are not being created due to a "Validation errors"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira custom field with Date Time Picker type. 
 !image-2021-02-25-20-50-05-354.png|thumbnail! 
 # Create an Insight post function - Create an Insight Object from a Jira Issue. Configure the 
 post function to set the Jira custom field from step 1.
 !image-2021-02-25-20-51-12-921.png|thumbnail! 
 # Add an attribute to the object type with DateTime type value.
 !image-2021-02-25-20-51-59-400.png|thumbnail! 
 # Configure Jira date time format as follows.
 #* Administration > System > General configuration > Advanced settings
 !image-2021-02-25-20-34-01-383.png|thumbnail! 
 #* Administration > System > Look and feel
  !image-2021-02-25-20-34-53-637.png|thumbnail! 
 # Create an issue and pick a date time value for the custom field created in step 1. This is how it looks like in the Jira issue view.
 !image-2021-02-25-20-40-43-669.png|thumbnail! 
 # Transition the issue so that a new object will be created.
 # Check the object created from the transition and check the date time value.

h3. Expected Results
The date time value is set correctly as expected

h3. Actual Results
* The date time format of the object does not respect Jira's date time settings
* The date time value is not set correctly
 !image-2021-02-25-20-39-22-531.png|thumbnail! 

*In a newer version Jira 8.20.1 (Insight 9.1.3),* objects are not being created due to a "Validation errors"

{code:java}
2021-11-17 10:49:49,786+0000 http-nio-8080-exec-9 ERROR admin 649x4572x1 11prhdq 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [c.r.j.p.i.s.j.workflow.postfunction.InsightWorkflowFunctionCreateObjectFromIssue] Failed to create object from Issue: IPF-6
com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.common.exception.ValidationInsightException: ValidationInsightException: Validation errors were found: rlabs-insight-attribute-700: ErrorMessage{i18nKey='rlabs.insight.i18n.constraint.violation.DateTime.range', parameters=[0017/Nov/19 11:08, 1753/Jan/1], additionalMessage=null}; 
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.validation.ValidateObjectImpl.validateObjectBean(ValidateObjectImpl.java:216)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.core.ObjectServiceImpl.storeObject(ObjectServiceImpl.java:382)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.core.ObjectServiceImpl.storeObject(ObjectServiceImpl.java:264)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.jira.workflow.postfunction.InsightWorkflowFunctionCreateObjectFromIssue.execute(InsightWorkflowFunctionCreateObjectFromIssue.java:144)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.jira.workflow.InsightWorkflowFunction.execute(InsightWorkflowFunction.java:1016)
{code}


h3. Workaround
Use the default date/time and picker format

h3. Note
Original bug - https://jira.mindville.com/browse/ICS-1679
fields.summary: Insight post function to create an Insight Object from a Jira Issue does not set date time value correctly or object is not created if Jira is using non-default date time picker format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We wish to import objects from CSV, and if the identifier is not matched - we expect the Import to create new objects in Insight.

We have identified a reproducible use case where the identified should miss and create new objects, but instead it updates an existing object

Insight 8.7.4
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create two object types: OTX and OTY
 # Configure Attributes so that OTX has two attributes (AttA, AttB), both are references to OTY (Cardinality 0-1) - you can add more attributes as you like.
 # Create two objects in OTY, call them OY1 and OY2
 # Create one object in OTX, call it OX1 and set the References: AttA=OY1 ; AttB=OY2
 # create a CSV with 3 columns, and the following values:
 Name,Col1,Col2
 OX1,OY1,OY1
 # Configure a CSV Import to with an OTX Object Type Map, map each Attribute accordingly, and +check all these 3 attributes to be identifiers+:
 Name>>>Name
 Col1>>>AttA   — IQL: Name=${Col1}
 Col2>>>AttB   — IQL: Name=${Col2}
 # Synchronize the CSV import

h3. Expected Results

As the Identifier misses, there will be a new object created in OTX:
 Name: OX1
 AttA: ref to OY1

AttB: ref to OY1
h3. Actual Results

The existing object gets updated

This behavior does not happen if Col1 != Col2
h3. Workaround

As a possible workaround - you may create a Text Attribute (hidden) to which you can map all three Datalocators - and make this Attribute your identifier, as it will contain the unique combination of the 3 values, and will not use the Reference Attributes.
fields.summary: Importing into Insight updates existing objects instead of creating new ones
